physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild proteinuria (0.2 g/L), elevated creatinine (166 µmol/L), optic disc coloboma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Chronic renal impairment developed, with serum creatinine increasing to 250 µmol/L by age 29.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Significant proteinuria (0.8 g/L), bilateral grade III to IV vesicoureteric reflux, and bilateral small kidneys.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent heavy proteinuria recorded on serial urinalyses.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Stable chronic renal impairment (creatinine 320 µmol/L), mild proteinuria and optic disc coloboma, normal visual acuity.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Bilateral optic disc coloboma and chronic renal impairment noted over time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral renal hypoplasia, mild chronic renal impairment (creatinine 100 µmol/L), bilateral optic disc coloboma.
Mild renal impairment (creatinine 57 µmol/L), asymmetrical right optic disc coloboma, no evidence of proteinuria.
Moderate renal impairment (creatinine 99 µmol/L), significant proteinuria (0.96 g/L), asymmetrical right optic disc coloboma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Enlargement of a single cyst in the right kidney noted at follow-up.
